definition: to compete to be first/to contest first place
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
early/prior/former/in advance/first
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another

sentences.english: Should take after the bus , not to vie with each other , not bicheng bit crowded.
sentences.chinese: 乘坐公共汽车应先下后上，勿争先恐后，勿挤逼抢位。

sentences.english: Dooku noticed that the Gold Team members were all scrambling to board a transport.
sentences.chinese: 杜库发觉金队队员都在争先恐后地登上飞行器。

sentences.english: Managers are scrambling to provide counseling and a suicide hotline for the young workforce.
sentences.chinese: 经理们争先恐后地为年轻劳动力提供咨询和自杀热线。

sentences.english: Journalists who were tipped off about the incident raced to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 事先听到有关此事风声的新闻记者争先恐后赶赴现场。

sentences.english: Many communities were scrambling to find the missing;
sentences.chinese: 许多社区在争先恐后地寻找失踪者。

sentences.english: Sprints shall be run according to the rules governing sprint races.
sentences.chinese: 运动员的冲刺，以争先赛的有关规则为准。

sentences.english: The panic - stricken passengers tried to rush the life - boats .
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的旅客争先恐后，想挤进救生艇。

sentences.english: Visitors swarned to mail the special postcards with certain stampers.
sentences.chinese: 游客争先恐后地给家里邮寄盖有特别邮戳的明信片。

sentences.english: The men scrambled back into the car and it moved off at a fantastic speed.
sentences.chinese: 那些人争先恐后地爬上汽车，以惊人的速度开跑了。

sentences.english: The banks fell over each other to lend money as they jostled for market share.
sentences.chinese: 银行竞相追求市场份额，于是争先发放贷款。

sentences.english: On arriving there, everybody went into action in no time. We dug square pits first.
sentences.chinese: 到了目的地后，大家不由分说，争先恐后地干起来。

sentences.english: Perhaps to be outdone, jujube scrambling to spit the verdant shoots.
sentences.chinese: 也许是不甘落后，枣树争先恐后地吐出了嫩绿的新芽。

sentences.english: On arriving there, everybody went into action in no time.
sentences.chinese: 到了目的地后，大家不由分说，争先恐后地干起来。

sentences.english: Olympic sprint is a team race.
sentences.chinese: 奥林匹克争先赛是一种团体赛。

definition: to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
competitive/eagerly/to vie
(idiom) not want to be outdone/not content to lag behind
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
variant of 摩拳擦掌[mo1 quan2 ca1 zhang3]
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
to swarm/to flock
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
